title: Ticket #2644: SetEffectiveOwner fails to detect current owner is effective owner
description:
QmgmtSetEffectiveOwner has a test at the top comparing the desired effective owner with the current owner so that I knows that no change or permissions are needed.

This test does not correctly handle the case when one of the values being compared is fully qualifed (i.e it contains a domain) and the other does not.

So, for instance SetEffectiveOwner("johnkn@crane") when current_owner=="johnkn" will fail unless johnkn is a QueueSuperUser.

It will also fail if the domain name on one side of the test is a different case than the other, but domain names are case-insensitive.
remarks:
2011-Nov-17 15:42:30 by jfrey:
I have two comments on your patch:

  • Consider using D_FULLDEBUG in QmgmtSetEffectiveOwner(). Otherwise, these messages could fill the schedd log very quickly.

  • is_same_user(): On unix, the default domain should be obtained via param("UID_DOMAIN"). Given that, you may want to change ASSUME_LOCALHOST to ASSUME_LOCAL_DOMAIN.

2011-Nov-21 14:18:16 by johnkn:
I have revised the patch based on feedback from Jaime as well as from discussions with Todd and Zach. The new patch uses param("UID_DOMAIN") rather than get_hostname() and allows for comparison of partially specified domains so that tonic will match tonic.cs.wisc.edu.
